image.alt: Smiling patients at Smiles by Dr Craig Hadgis Orthodontist

Home.title: Welcome to Smiles by Dr Craig Hadgis Orthodontist

paragraphs.text: Dr. Hadgis prides himself on providing the best orthodontic experience and excellent service. His mission is to deliver the highest-quality pediatric and orthodontic care in a manner that makes the entire experience a pleasure. The practice serves St. Augustine, St. Johns and Jacksonville, and stays current with advanced technologies, including 3D imaging, digital treatment planning and modern systems to offer personalized, precise, efficient care.

We believe in accessible, patient-centered care, including complimentary orthodontic evaluations for children by age seven and an emphasis on creating beautiful, lasting smiles for families in our community. To schedule a complimentary evaluation please call or text 904.79.SMILE (904-797-6453).

items.title: Board-Certified Care

image.alt: Orthodontic care with modern digital tools

items.text: Dr. Craig Hadgis is a board‑certified orthodontist who uses modern digital tools, including iTero scanning, 3D imaging and digital treatment planning, to deliver predictable, personalized results.

items.title: No Referral Needed

image.alt: Easy scheduling and promotions for new patients

items.text: New patients are welcome without a referral, and we offer complimentary evaluations for children by age seven to guide early, preventive care.

items.title: Community-Focused Care

image.alt: Orthodontic team caring for a patient

items.text: A warm, family-like environment with active community outreach and sponsorships keeps our practice connected to the people we serve.

items.title: Flexible Financing

image.alt: Financing options and patient portal access

items.text: Multiple financing options, including CareCredit, plus a secure patient portal make treatment affordable and easy to manage online.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Craig Hadgis, DDS, is a board‑certified orthodontist and Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics. He provides customized, digitally planned orthodontic care for children and adults and uses leading-edge technologies such as impressionless 3D scanning, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, Damon™ braces, Insignia® custom appliances, and low-dose 3D X-rays.
From traditional braces to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, we offer a range of services to suit every patient.

testimonials.author: Qwanda
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Hadgis and his staff has always given me exceptional service with all my office visits and treatments. I'm so glad that I chose their office!”

testimonials.author: JueJue
testimonials.testimonial: “My kids complemented this place as we left. Not because of the arcade but the service, the atmosphere, and the doctors who are so kind. Everyone was sweet hearted and friendly. It was more like a family than anything.”

testimonials.author: Erica
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Craig Hadgis is by far the best orthodontist I have ever been to. They were the first among many dentists and orthodontists I have seen in my life to actually provide care, compassion and support.”

image.alt: Orthodontic team standing together in a bright office, welcoming patients

paragraphs.text: Our Mission: To Be Your Affordable Orthodontist. We are committed to delivering the highest quality orthodontic care in a way that keeps treatment accessible and comfortable for every family we serve.

A very important factor in saving orthodontic expense for your family is to schedule your children for a complimentary orthodontic evaluation by age seven. Early evaluation lets us guide growth and development so treatment is simpler when it’s needed.

Dr. Craig Hadgis and his team offer a full range of modern options, including Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, Damon™ self-ligating braces, Insignia™ custom systems, and 3D digital scanning to create predictable, efficient treatment plans.
Expect gentle, personalized care from a team that listens. We look forward to creating beautiful, healthy smiles for you and your family. — Dr. Craig Hadgis and Team

image.alt: Dr. Craig Hadgis smiling in his office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Craig Hadgis earned a B.S. in Industrial Engineering (2001) and an M.S. in Biomedical Engineering (2003) from the University of Michigan. He received his DDS from the University of Detroit Mercy in 2007 and completed post-DDS advanced education in general dentistry in 2008. Dr. Hadgis completed his Orthodontic Specialty Certification at the School of Orthodontics at Jacksonville University in 2010.

Dr. Hadgis is a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics. He is an active member of professional organizations including the American Association of Orthodontists, World Federation of Orthodontists, Southern Association of Orthodontists, Florida Association of Orthodontists, American Dental Association, Florida Dental Association, Northeast District Dental Association, and the Jacksonville Dental Society.

Dr. Hadgis provides full-service modern orthodontics, using technologies such as impressionless iTero® 3D scanning, low-dose 3D imaging, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, Damon™ and Insignia™ appliance systems, and digitally planned treatment to improve comfort and predictability.

image.alt: Dr. Craig Hadgis in treatment room

paragraphs.text: Originally from a family with strong local ties, Dr. Hadgis and his wife Anne are raising three children in the St. Augustine area. He enjoys family time, reading, exercise, dancing, and beach outings, and he is active in the local community, including the St. Augustine Rotary Club.

paragraphs.text: We believe that a strong community leads to healthier, happier people. We support 39 local schools and partner with community organizations, churches, and programs like Smiles Change Lives to help more children access orthodontic care. We are proud to live, work, play, and raise our families here in St. Augustine and St. Johns.

image.alt: Smiles Change Lives partnership and community giving

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Your initial examination gives you the opportunity to meet our team, review your dental and medical history, and receive a complete oral exam with X-rays to determine whether orthodontic treatment is needed and which options suit you best.

We will help you create a customized treatment plan, review financial and insurance options, and answer any questions. After your exam we’ll schedule your first appointment and explain what to expect during treatment.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: If your insurance covers orthodontic treatment, your policy may include a separate lifetime orthodontic benefit. Our team will verify your coverage, file claims for you, and apply any available benefit to your treatment fee.
We offer flexible payment plans to fit most budgets and accept CareCredit for additional financing. Our treatment coordinator will review options and help you choose what works best.

For your convenience please complete the patient information form before your first visit. Submitting your form by noon the day prior allows our team to review your history and be ready when you arrive.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Our smooth mini low-profile metal braces remain a reliable option for many patients. Made from high-grade stainless steel, metal braces use small brackets and archwires to move teeth efficiently while offering durability and cost-effectiveness.

Self-ligating braces use a specialized clip instead of elastics, reducing friction and often decreasing appointment frequency. They are available in metal or clear brackets and can make hygiene and comfort easier during treatment.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces are made of tooth-colored materials to blend with your smile. They are popular with older teens and adults who want a less noticeable option, though they require careful oral hygiene and occasional extra attention.
Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of custom, clear aligners to gently shift teeth into place. Aligners are removable, making eating and oral hygiene easier compared with traditional braces.
At your appointment we capture a precise 3D model with our iTero® scanner, so we can plan treatment digitally and produce aligners that fit accurately from the start.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Damon™ Smile is a passive self-ligating system that uses a slide mechanism instead of elastic ties. That can reduce pressure on the teeth, improve comfort, and often shorten treatment time while making hygiene easier.

Insignia™ combines virtual 3D planning with custom-manufactured brackets and archwires for a treatment tailored to your mouth. That customization can improve precision and reduce time spent in braces.
With Insignia we design the final tooth positions digitally, then create appliances and wires specific to your plan for more predictable results and fewer in-office adjustments.

image.alt: 3D treatment planning software showing orthodontic simulation

paragraphs.text: LightForce™ uses 3D printing to create fully customized brackets and treatment components. The tailored approach can improve accuracy, comfort, and efficiency compared with off-the-shelf appliances.
The LightForce system pairs digital planning with custom-printed brackets and trays to deliver a treatment designed specifically for your smile.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers preserve your new alignment. We offer removable options, Essix-style clear retainers, and fixed bonded retainers depending on your needs and lifestyle.
Your team will recommend the right retainer and wearing schedule, and provide instructions to keep retainers in good condition for long-term stability.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about Invisalign<sup>®</sup> treatment, how it works, what to expect, and how to schedule a consultation at our St. Augustine and St. Johns offices.

The Invisalign system is the virtually invisible way to straighten teeth using a series of clear, custom-made aligners. Advanced 3D computer imaging maps your treatment from the starting position to the planned final result, and individual aligners are worn for about two weeks each as your teeth move gradually toward their new alignment. Your doctor will determine your treatment time based on your specific needs.

Yes. Invisalign aligners are removable so you can eat and drink without restrictions, and you can brush and floss normally to keep your teeth and gums healthy. Because the aligners are clear, most people maintain a natural-looking smile during treatment. Appointments are usually brief, with routine progress checks about every six weeks, so treatment fits into a busy life.

accordion.header: What are the primary benefits of Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: Invisalign aligners are clear and removable, making them a discreet, convenient option. Unlike traditional metal braces, they do not use brackets or wires that can irritate the mouth, and they allow you to eat, drink, and maintain oral hygiene more easily. The technology also lets you preview a virtual treatment plan so you can see the expected result before you begin.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment times vary by case, but many patients complete care within 12 to 24 months. Your doctor will evaluate your needs and provide a personalized timeline during your first appointment.

accordion.header: How many patients have used Invisalign<sup>®</sup>?

paragraphs.text: More than 5,000,000 patients worldwide have been treated with Invisalign aligners, and that number grows daily. At your consultation we can answer your questions and discuss whether Invisalign is a good fit for your smile goals.

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: Scheduling is easy. Call or text us at 904-797-6453 (904.79.SMILE) or request a free initial exam online at https://www.drcraigortho.com/appointment-request. We have convenient offices in St. Augustine and St. Johns to serve your family.
